pages.text:
Vegas Style Poker
◆◆◆
The electric atmosphere of Vegas style gaming awaits!
From the moment you join our tables, you’re swept into a world of excitement and luxury, reminiscent of a night out in Sin City. Our poker room is more than a place to play; it’s an entertainment paradise, where the vibrant beats of live concerts and the allure of our Tiki Bar create a backdrop that rivals the Vegas experience. Our Vegas style tables, standing tall, are dedicated exclusively to delivering that high-stake, high-reward gaming that poker lovers crave.
Feel the warmth of our community as you’re welcomed into a setting where every player is VIP. Our elite team, renowned for exceptional service, ensures that your experience at Vegas Style Poker transcends the ordinary. At Oxford Downs, every deal, every hand, every moment is designed to win your heart and thrill your senses. It’s not just about the game; it’s about the unforgettable memories made at the turn of every card. Join us for an unrivaled poker adventure, where the spirit of Vegas comes to life and every visit is a chance to capture the jackpot of joy.
◆ ◆ ◆
Our Vegas Style Poker Games
Step right up to the ultimate Vegas style poker experience at our tables, where six thrilling poker variations await to test your skill and luck! Our Vegas style poker games are played 7 handed: so plan ahead! On weekends, these tables can get full! Whether you’re a fan of the classics or eager to try something new, our selection has something for every poker enthusiast. Don’t miss out on the action – click here to familiarize yourself with our house rules and join the excitement today!
Ready to deal you in, are you up for the challenge?
Three Card Poker
Three Card Poker pits the player’s hand against the dealer’s in a heads-up match. After placing ante bets, each party receives three cards, with players then deciding to fold or match their ante with a “play” wager. The reveal comes next; the dealer’s hand must be Queen high to qualify. If the dealer doesn’t qualify, ante bets are paid out at even money, and play wagers are returned. If the dealer qualifies and the player wins, both ante and play wagers pay even money, a tie results in a push. Players can also place additional bets like the Pair Plus, which pays out if the player’s hand contains a pair or better, and the Ante Bonus for straight or better hands, offering payouts up to 5 to 1, with both these bets winning irrespective of the dealer’s hand.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
Crazy 4 Poker
“Crazy 4 Poker” is an exhilarating card game that involves head-to-head play against the dealer and features two bonus bets. Players start by making equal Ante and Super Bonus wagers, with an optional Queens Up wager. Each player and the dealer receive five cards to create the best four-card poker hand. Players can fold or continue by matching their Ante or betting up to three times their Ante with a pair of Aces or better. Winning involves beating the dealer’s qualifying hand or benefiting when the dealer does not qualify. The game also includes special payouts for high-ranking hands like four Aces.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
Face Up Pai Gow Poker
Face Up Pai Gow Poker spices up the classic game by dealing the dealer’s seven cards face-up, adding a new level of strategy with head-to-head play against the dealer. This variant also features the optional Fortune Bonus and Ace-High side bets, enhancing the excitement of the game.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
Double D’s Wild Card Stud
Double D’s Wild Stud Poker is a captivating five-card game featuring a Designated Player, against whom all other participants play. Like other poker variations with this role, the Designated Player is responsible for collecting losses and distributing winnings, up to the amount of their wager, adding a unique and engaging twist to the traditional poker experience.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
Fortune Pai Gow Poker
Fortune Pai Gow Poker offers an enticing optional bonus bet focusing on the strongest hand you can assemble from your seven cards. Place any bet within the table’s limits, but keep in mind that a minimum Fortune bet of $5 not only ups the ante but also makes you eligible for the coveted Envy Bonus payouts, adding an extra layer of excitement to your game. This game is played with 53 cards, including the joker.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
Ultimate Texas Hold ’em
In Ultimate Texas Hold ’em, the goal is to craft a five-card hand that tops the dealer’s, using two personal cards and five community cards. It encourages assertive betting, the earlier the bet, the higher the stakes and potential winnings. Bets placed pre-flop can be three or four times the Ante, while a bet on the flop allows for doubling the Ante. Waiting for the river means bets can only match the Ante. Additionally, the game spices things up with an optional Trips bonus wager, rewarding players whose final hand is at least a three of a kind.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
I Luv Suits
“I Luv Suits” is an engaging card game where the main objective is to outdo the dealer by having more cards of the same suit, regardless of their rank. Players can place multiple wagers including Flush Rush and Flush Rush Bonus bets. The game begins with an Ante wager, followed by the option to raise the stakes depending on the strength of the player’s flush. The excitement of the game comes from the strategic decisions in betting and the potential for high payouts based on the number of suited cards. This game offers a fresh twist on traditional poker, providing an enjoyable experience for players who enjoy card games with a unique challenge.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY

Tiki Bar Events
◆◆◆
Every Thursday night, Oxford Downs transforms into a vibrant stage for karaoke enthusiasts, with the energetic DJ Big Country – who expertly deals cards by day and spins tracks by night – at the helm. As both a beloved dealer and an entertainer, DJ Big Country brings a personal touch to the microphone, inviting you to take the spotlight and belt out your favorite tunes. Whether you’re looking to be the next karaoke sensation or just enjoying the show, these nights are a perfect blend of music, camaraderie, and the unique charm that only Oxford Downs can offer.

Tiki Bar
◆◆◆
Embark on a tropical escape at the Oxford Downs Tiki Bar, a gem that stands out as potentially the largest tiki bar in Florida. Open for your enjoyment 7 days a week, this unique haven offers a laid-back atmosphere that’s perfect for unwinding after a game of poker or simply to enjoy the evening breeze. Challenge your friends to a game of corn hole or pool on one of our 2 (soon to be 4) pool tables. With an impressive array of 26 TVs outside, you won’t miss a second of sports action or your favorite shows as you sip on exotic cocktails and soak in the ambiance that only a tiki bar of this stature can provide.
Thursday nights at Oxford Downs Tiki Bar are not to be missed, as the venue comes alive with popular karaoke sessions hosted by none other than DJ Big Country, who doubles as a dealer at our poker room. Sing your heart out, cheer for your friends, or just enjoy the live performances as you revel in the vibrant community spirit. Whether you’re a karaoke enthusiast or just looking for a lively spot to relax and socialize, the Oxford Downs Tiki Bar promises a night of fun and entertainment under the Florida sky.
◆ ◆ ◆
Customize Your Music Experience at the Tiki Bar!
Download the Touchtunes app using the QR code or the button below to choose songs to play out at the Tiki bar!
click here to download

Event content
Oxford Downs Ladies Event on Saturday, September 6th
◆​ ◆​ ◆
Join us for a special day of poker made for the ladies!
With a
$100 buy-in
, 20-minute levels, and 20,000 starting chips, this event is the perfect chance to showcase your skills and enjoy the excitement of tournament play.
The event will be played
9-handed
and uses the
big blind ante
format. Registration is available in person on the day of.
Date & Time:
Saturday, September 6th at 11:15 AM
Buy-In (Women):
$100 ($67 prize pool + $21 house fee + $10 staff fee + $2 jackpot)
Buy-In (Men):
$1,000
Levels:
20 minutes
Re-Entry:
Available until the start of Level 9
Location:
Oxford Downs – 17996 US-301, Summerfield, FL
Whether you’re new to the game or a seasoned player, the Ladies Event is a great way to connect, compete, and celebrate the game of poker.
We look forward to welcoming you – see you at the tables!
.tribe-events-single-event-description

Poker
◆◆◆
Why settle for the ordinary when Oxford Downs offers an extraordinary poker adventure?
Oxford Downs is the premier destination for poker enthusiasts in Oxford, Florida, where the thrill of the game meets unparalleled service. At Oxford Downs, we’re not just a poker room; we’re a vibrant entertainment hub! Our commitment to your enjoyment is evident in every corner, from the lively Tiki Bar and engaging pickleball courts to the pulsating rhythms of live concerts.
Every member is treated like family. Our skilled team, hailed as the finest in the state, goes above and beyond to ensure you have the best customer experience in the state. Join us at Oxford Downs, where every play is a step towards winning not just a pot, but an experience that’s second to none.
Whether you’re here to call, raise, or go all in, we offer an environment that extends beyond the tables. Our commitment to your enjoyment is evident in every corner, from the lively Tiki Bar and engaging pickleball courts to the pulsating rhythms of live concerts.
◆ ◆ ◆
Our Poker Games
Step right up to the ultimate poker experience at our tables, where seven thrilling poker variations await to test your skill and luck! These poker games are played 9-handed. Whether you’re a fan of the classics or eager to try something new, our selection has something for every poker enthusiast. Don’t miss out on the action—click here to familiarize yourself with our house rules and join the excitement today!
Ready to deal you in, are you up for the challenge?
Ranking of Hands
There’s many different hands contained in a deck of cards including a royal flush, full, house, straight, two pair, and flush.
LEARN THE RANKING OF HANDS
7 Card Stud
Experience the excitement of Seven-Card Stud Poker, where each player is strategically dealt seven cards over five rounds — starting with two hidden and one revealed card, followed by three rounds of face-up cards, and concluding with a final card dealt face down. After each round, the tension builds with a round of betting, culminating in a showdown where players choose their best five-card hand from their individual seven-card ensemble. It’s a test of foresight, strategy, and nerves, perfect for poker aficionados seeking a twist on the classic game.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
7 Card Stud Hi-Lo
In 7 Stud Hi-Lo, the thrill doubles as the pot is divided equally between the highest and the lowest hand. To claim the low half of the pot, a player must present a qualifying hand of five distinct cards, all ranking 8 or lower, with straights and flushes not affecting the low hand eligibility. This twist adds a layer of strategy, as players aim to scoop both halves of the pot with hands skillfully crafted to win high and qualify low.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
Omaha
Omaha is a community card poker game akin to Texas hold ’em. Players receive four cards each and must forge their best hand using a precise combination of two personal cards and three from the five communal cards laid out on the table, demanding a keen strategy and sharp decision-making.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
Omaha Hi-Lo
Omaha Hi-Lo, a dynamic poker variant, incorporates a “qualifier” for the low hand where all cards must be ranked eight or lower. In this game, players are dealt four individual cards and strive to construct the superior hand by selecting exactly two of their own cards and three from the five community cards on the table, adding an intriguing layer of strategy in pursuit of both high and low winning combinations.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
Texas Hold ’em
Texas Hold ’em is a widely favored poker variant where players each receive two private ‘hole’ cards and share five community cards, revealed in three stages: first three cards (‘the flop’), then one additional card (‘the turn’), and a final card (‘the river’). Participants aim to craft the strongest five-card hand possible using any combination of their hole cards and the community cards, making for a game full of strategy and anticipation.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
Pineapple Hold ’em
Pineapple poker tweaks the Texas Hold ’em format by dealing players three ‘hole’ cards instead of two. Alongside the five community cards revealed in the traditional three stages—the ‘flop,’ ‘turn,’ and ‘river’—players work to assemble the best five-card hand. The additional hole card adds a layer of complexity and strategic depth, as players decide not only which cards to keep but also which to discard, heightening the anticipation and strategic maneuvering of the game.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
Crazy Pineapple Hold ’em
Crazy Pineapple poker starts like the regular version, with each player receiving three hole cards. The twist comes as players hold all three cards through the initial betting rounds, only discarding one before the ‘turn’ card is dealt. Beyond this distinctive rule, all other gameplay elements, including betting structures and the quest to build the best hand, remain identical to standard Pineapple poker, offering a familiar yet refreshingly unpredictable twist on the classic game.
LEARN HOW TO PLAY
